description: Open Energy Plaftorm (OEP) metadata schema v1.5.0

@context.description: Explanation of metadata keys in ontology terms.
@context.title: @context

name.description: A file name or database table name
name.title: Name

title.description: A human readable full title including author.
title.title: Title

id.description: An Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that unambiguously identifies the resource. This can be a URL on the data set. It can also be a Digital Object Identifier (DOI).
id.title: Id

@id.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that links the resource via the databus
@id.title: @Id

description.description: A description or abstract of the package. It should be usable as summary information for the entire package that is described by the metadata.
description.example: Example table used to illustrate the metadata structure and meaning.
description.title: Description

language.description: Language used within the described data structures (e.g. titles, descriptions). The language key can be repeated if more languages are used. Standard: IETF (BCP47).
language.title: Language

subject.description: References the topic of the resource in ontology terms as a list

items.description: A subject object to reference to the ontology. There can be several such objects. Each has all name-value-pairs.

name.description: The class label of the OEO terms.
name.title: Name

subject.title: Subject

keywords.description: An array of keywords to assist users searching for the package in catalogs.
keywords.title: Keyword

publicationDate.description: A date of publishing of the data or metadata. Date format is ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD).
publicationDate.title: Publication date

context.description: An object that describes the general setting, environment, or project leading to the creation or maintenance of this dataset. In science this is can be the research project.

documentation.description: A URL of the project documentation.
documentation.title: Documentation

sourceCode.description: A URL of the projects source code.
sourceCode.title: Source code

contact.description: A reference to the creator or maintainer of the data set. It can be an email address or a GitHub handle.
contact.title: E-Mail contact

grantNo.description: An identifying grant number. In case of a publicly funded project, this number is assigned by the funding agency.
grantNo.title: Grant no

fundingAgency.description: A name of the entity providing the funding. This can be a government agency or a company.
fundingAgency.title: Funding agency

fundingAgencyLogo.description: A URL to the logo or image of the funding agency.
fundingAgencyLogo.title: Funding agency logo

publisherLogo.description: A URL to the logo of the publishing agency of data.
publisherLogo.title: Publisher logo

context.title: Context

spatial.description: An object that describes the spatial context of the data it contains.

location.description: A location of the data. In case of data where the location can be described as a point. May be specified as coordinates, URI or addresses with street, house number and zip code.
location.title: Location

extent.description: A covered area. May be the name of a region, or the geometry of a bounding box.
extent.title: Extent

resolution.description: Pixel size in case of a regular raster image. Reference to administrative level or other spatial division that is present as the smallest spatially distinguished unit size.
resolution.title: Resolution

spatial.title: Spatial

temporal.description: An object with the time period covered in the data. Temporal information should either contain a "referenceDate" or the keys describing a time series; in rare cases both.

referenceDate.description: The base year, month or day. Point in time for which the data is meant to be accurate. The census data or a satellite image will have a reference date. Date Format is ISO 8601.
referenceDate.title: Reference date

timeseries.description: An array that describes the timeseries.

start.description: The beginning point in time of a time series.
start.title: Start

end.description: The end point in time of a time series.
end.title: End

resolution.description: The time span between individual points of information in a time series.
resolution.title: Resolution

alignment.description: An indicator whether stamps in a time series are left, right or middle.
alignment.title: Alignment

aggregationType.description: Indicates whether the values are a sum, average or current.
aggregationType.title: Aggregation type

timeseries.title: Timeseries

temporal.title: Temporal

sources.description: An array of objects with the used and underlying sources of the data and metadata.

items.description: Source object in list of source objects. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: A human readable title of the source, a document title or organisation name.
title.title: Title

description.description: A free text description of the data set.
description.example: Scientific climate change report by the UN
description.title: Description

path.description: A URL to the original source.
path.title: Path

licenses.description: An array of objects under which the source is provided.

items.description: A license object under which the described source is provided. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.example: Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0
title.title: Title

path.description: A link to the license text.
path.title: Path

instruction.description: A short description of rights and restrictions. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
instruction.example: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute, and share derivations under the same license. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-(odbl) for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: The copyright owner of the source. If attribution licenses are used, that name must be acknowledged.
attribution.title: Attribution

items.title: Licenses

licenses.title: Licenses

items.title: Sources

sources.title: Sources

licenses.description: An array of objects of the license(s) under which the described package is provided. It can depend on the licenses of the sources (copyleft or share-alike) or can be granted by the creator of the data.

items.description: A license object under which the described package is provided. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.example: Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0
title.title: Title

path.description: A link to the license text.
path.title: Path

instruction.description: A short description of rights and restrictions. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
instruction.example: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute, and share derivations under the same license. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-(odbl) for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: The copyright owner of the data. If attribution licenses are used, that name must be acknowledged.
attribution.title: Attribution

items.title: Licenses

licenses.title: Licenses

contributors.description: The people or organizations who contributed to this data package. List of objects.

items.description: An array of objects of the people or organizations who contributed to the data or metadata. Each object refers to one contributor. Every contributor must have a title and property. The path, email, role and organization properties are optional.

email.description: A email address of the contributor or GitHub handle.
email.title: Email

date.description: The date of the contribution. If the contribution took more than a day, use the date of the final contribiution. Date Format is ISO 8601.
date.title: Date

object.description: The target of the contribution. Which part of the package was supplied or changed. Can be the data, metadata or both (data and metadata).
object.title: Object

comment.description: A free text commentary on what has been done.
comment.example: Fixed a typo in the title.
comment.title: Comment

items.title: Contributors

contributors.title: Contributors

resources.description: Resources, described as a list of data resource format objects.

items.description: An array of objects of the data. It describes the data resource as an individual file or (database) table.

profile.description: The profile of this descriptor according to the profiles specification. This information is retained in order to comply with the "Tabular Data Package" standard. Use "tabular-data-resource" for all tables.
profile.title: Profile

name.description: A name for the entire data package. To comply with the data package standard it must consist of only lowercase alphanumeric character plus ".", "-" and "_". It may not start with a number. In a database, this will be the name of the table within the schema containing it. The name usually corresponds to the file name (minus the file-extension) of the data file describing the resource.
name.title: Name

path.description: A URL that should be a permanent http(s) address or other path directly linking to the resource.
path.title: Path

format.description: The file extension. 'csv', 'xls', 'json' etc. would be expected to be the standard file extension for this type of resource. When you upload your data to the OEDB, in the shown metadata string, the format will be changed accordingly to 'PostgreSQL', since the data there are stored in a database.
format.title: Format

encoding.description: Specifies the character encoding of the resource's data file. The values should be one of the "Preferred MIME Names" for a character encoding registered with IANA. If no value for this key is specified then the default is UTF-8.
encoding.title: Encoding

schema.description: An object that describes the structure of the present data. It contains all fields (columns of the table), the primary key and optional foreign keys.

items.description: An array of objects describing a column and providing name, description, type and unit.

description.example: Reference year for which the data were collected.
description.title: Description

type.description: The data type of the field. In case of a geom column in a database, also indicate the shape and CRS.
type.title: Type

unit.description: The unit, preferably SI-unit, that values in this field are mapped to. If 'unit' doesn't apply to a field, use 'null'. If the unit is given in a seperate field, reference this field.
unit.title: Unit

is_about.description: An array of objects with describe the field in OEO terms.

name.description: The class label of the OEO terms.
name.title: Name

is_about.title: Is about

value_reference.description: An array of objects for an extended description of the values in the column in OEO terms.

value.description: The name of the value in the column.
value.title: Value

name.description: The class label of the OEO terms.
name.title: Name

value_reference.title: Is about

items.title: Field

primaryKey.description: A primary key is a field or set of fields that uniquely identifies each row in the table. It is recorded as an array, since it is possible to define the primary key as made up of several columns.
primaryKey.title: Primary key

items.description: A foreign key is a field that refers to a column in another table.

fields.description: The column in the table that is constrainted by the foreign key.
fields.title: Fields

reference.description: The reference to the foreign table.
reference.title: Reference

items.title: Foreign Key

schema.title: Schema

dialect.description: Object. A CSV Dialect defines a simple format to describe the various dialects of CSV files in a language agnostic manner. In case of a database, the values in the containing fields are 'null'.

delimiter.description: The delimiter specifies the character sequence which should separate fields (columns). Common characters are "," (comma), "." (point) and "\t" (tab).
delimiter.title: Delimiter

decimalSeparator.description: A symbol used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number written in decimal form. Depending on language and region this symbol can be "." or ",".
decimalSeparator.title: Decimal separator

dialect.title: Dialect

items.title: Resource

resources.title: Resource

review.description: Data uploaded through the OEP needs to go through review. The review will cover the areas described here: https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/data-preprocessing/wiki and carried out by a team of the platform. The review itself is documented at the specified path and a badge is rewarded with regards to completeness.

path.description: A URL or path string, that should be a permanent http(s) address directly linking to the documented review. Example: https://www.example.com
path.title: Path

badge.description: A badge of either Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platin is used to label the given metadata based on its quality. Example: Platin
badge.title: Badge

review.title: Review

metaMetadata.description: Object. Description about the metadata themselves, their format, version and license. These fields should already be provided when you’re filling out your metadata.

metadataVersion.description: Type and version number of the metadata. Example: OEP-1.5
metadataVersion.title: Metadata version

metadataLicense.description: Object describing the license of the provided metadata.

title.description: Official (human readable) license title. Example: Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal
title.title: Title

path.description: Url or path string, that is a fully qualified HTTP address. Example: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/
path.title: Path

metadataLicense.title: Metadata license

metaMetadata.title: Meta metadata

_comment.description: Object. The “_comment”-section is used as a self-description of the final metadata-file. It is text, intended for humans and can include a link to the metadata documentation(s), required value formats and similar remarks. The comment section has no fix structure or mandatory values, but a useful self-description, similar to the one depicted here, is encouraged.

metadata.description: Reference to the metadata documentation in use. Example: Metadata documentation and explanation (https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/organisation/wiki/metadata)
metadata.title: Metadata

dates.description: Comment on data/time format. Example: Dates and time must follow the ISO8601 including time zone (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh)
dates.title: Dates

units.description: Comment on units. Example: If you must use units in cells (which is discouraged), leave a space between numbers and units (100 m)
units.title: Units

languages.description: Comment on language format. Example: Languages must follow the IETF (BCP47) format (en-GB, en-US, de-DE)
languages.title: Languages

licenses.description: Reference to license format. Example: License name must follow the SPDX License List (https://spdx.org/licenses/)
licenses.title: Licenses

review.description: Reference to review documentation. Example: Following the OEP Data Review (https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/data-preprocessing/wiki)
review.title: Review

null.description: Feel free to add more descriptive comments. Like "null". Example: If a field is not applicable just enter "null"
null.title: Null

todo.description: If an applicable value is not yet available and will be inserted later on use: 'todo'
todo.title: Todo

_comment.title: _comment
